EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0) – Smelts iron ore into iron plates to support crafting operations.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0) – Extracts iron ore.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5) – Transfers ore from the extraction point.
• Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5) – Delivers extracted ore.
• Iron Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5) – Stores delivered ore.
• Intermediate Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -47.5) – Feeds ore to a remote branch.
• Burner Inserter (position: -14.5, -47.5) – Moves ore along the intermediate belt.
• Remote Output Chest (position: -13.5, -47.5) – Receives ore from the remote inserter.

### Copper Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace (position: -27.0, -60.0) – Smelts copper ore into copper plates.

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Consists of:
• Lab (position: 0.5, 2.5) – Processes science packs.
• Offshore Pump (Working) (position: -7.5, 25.5) – Draws water.
• Boiler (Original) (position: 2.0, 17.5) – Provides basic boiler functionality.
• Boiler (Repositioned) (position: 10.0, 6.5) – Fueled with coal; status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: no input liquid, no fluid present in connections.
• Steam Engine (position: 5.5, 5.5) – Generates electricity; status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: not connected to power network, no input liquid, no fluid present in connections.
• Electricity Network – Composed of small electric poles linking production components.
(Note: An attempted reposition of an additional Offshore Pump from position (-4.5, 26.5) to (10.0, 7.0) failed; that pump remains available in inventory.)

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine (position: 3.5, 0.5) – Configured for pipe crafting.
• Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5) – Stores crafted pipes.
• Electricity Network – Comprised of small electric poles linking production components.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Research Prerequisite and Electronics Research Errors
 - Ensure Automation research is fully complete before reattempting Electronics research; verify that all prerequisite science pack requirements are satisfied.
 - Complete preceding research stages (Automation, Automation2, and Electronics) before progressing to fluid-handling and oil processing.

• Automation Science Pack Crafting and Insertion Errors
 - Confirm that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels produced from iron plates) and proper production facilities (furnaces or crafting machines) are available before crafting automation science packs.
 - Verify that the inventory contains sufficient automation-science-packs prior to insertion into the Lab.

• Offshore Pump Placement and Fluid Connection Errors
 - Ensure the player is within the allowed placement range when repositioning an Offshore Pump; move closer to the target (within max distance) before placement.
 - Confirm that connection points between offshore pumps and boilers are unobstructed and within valid range for fluid transfer.

• Pipeline Construction and Connection Errors
 - Double-check connection points for multi-segment pipelines to ensure alignment and that target tiles are buildable.
 - Validate that all intermediate nodes and segment endpoints meet fluid transfer requirements.

• API Usage and Undefined Function Pitfalls
 - Use only defined API functions (e.g. get_entity, rotate_entity) when adjusting entity positions.
 - Validate the retrieval of entities to avoid errors during repositioning or connection operations.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────
• get_entity(entity: Any, position: Any) -> Any  
 Retrieves an entity of the specified type at the given position. Returns the entity on success; raises an exception if not found.

• pipe_entity(pipe: entities.Pipe) -> Any  
 Processes a pipe entity during pipeline connection routines.

• rotate_entity(entity: Any, direction: Any) -> Any  
 Rotates the given entity to the specified direction to correct alignment during placement.

Important Variables:
• pump_working (OffshorePump) – Holds the working offshore pump entity at position (-7.5, 25.5).
• new_pump_pos (Position) – Stores the target position for attempted offshore pump repositioning.
• pipe_count (int) – Represents the current number of pipes available in the inventory.
• distance (float) – Computed distance between designated start and end positions during manual pipeline construction.
• final_inventory (Inventory) – Snapshot of current inventory item counts after recent crafting and placement attempts.
